channel.title: Rule Debate
channel.description:
I think we should discuss this and come to a conclusion for the future, because I have already seen this be a problem not only in my old city, but also in others. Here it is:
If person A owns a plot of land, and allows person B to build on this land as a 'tenant' of sorts, is person A allowed to kick person B out, and in the process destroy everything person B built?
Here are my opinions: [ul][li]First of all, person A's land should have to be clearly marked some how (say with a wall or something), OR person B's buildings should have to be within a certain radius.[/li] [li]Secondly, I think person A needs to give person B X number of hours notice before destroying a building (thus giving person B time to move out), and if person A doesn't do this, destroying the house or whatever should be considered griefing [/li][/ul] What do you guys think?

item.title: Rule Debate
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

Here’s the way I see it: if it’s my land and I give you permission to build on it, it’s still my land. What if you build a giant penis on my land and I want to remove it? Just saying that the owners will be dumb isn’t going to work - if the person doesn’t want the risk of having their property taken down, then they can just go build on another piece of land they don’t own.

As far as I’m concerned and city who supports this needs raiding, it’s just the stripping of rights and a loop hole in the griefing rule for those who have the resources to do it.

item.title: Rule Debate
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

I think we should discuss this and come to a conclusion for the future, because I have already seen this be a problem not only in my old city, but also in others.

Here it is:

If person A owns a plot of land, and allows person B to build on this land as a 'tenant' of sorts, is person A allowed to kick person B out, and in the process destroy everything person B built?

Here are my opinions:

[ul][li]First of all, person A’s land should have to be clearly marked some how (say with a wall or something), OR person B’s buildings should have to be within a certain radius.[/li]
[li]Secondly, I think person A needs to give person B X number of hours notice before destroying a building (thus giving person B time to move out), and if person A doesn’t do this, destroying the house or whatever should be considered griefing [/li][/ul]

What do you guys think?
